head.title: Paid Notice: Deaths ROBBINS, CECIL JOY

hedline.hl1: Paid Notice: Deaths ROBBINS, CECIL JOY

block.p: ROBBINS-Cecil Joy, former ballerina, protege of Harriet Hoctor, featured dancer at Billy Rose's Diamond Horseshoe, Lou Walters Latin Quarter, and niteclubs and theaters throughout the country passed away peacefully at home on September 25, 2000. She loved life with a vivacious and energetic passion which she passed on to all in her family and her many friends. She is survived by her lovng husband Jules, daughter Linda, sons Steven and David, brother Harold, sister Myrna and grandchildren Skyler, Alex, Marc and Mick. Services on Thursday, September 28, 2000 at 12:45 PM at The Riverside Chapel, 76 St & Amsterdam Ave.

She loved life with a vivacious and energetic passion which she passed on to all in her family and her many friends. She is survived by her lovng husband Jules, daughter Linda, sons Steven and David, brother Harold, sister Myrna and grandchildren Skyler, Alex, Marc and Mick. Services on Thursday, September 28, 2000 at 12:45 PM at The Riverside Chapel, 76 St & Amsterdam Ave.
